verses.verse: The word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068> came again unto me, saying <WH559>,
Now, thou son <WH1121> of man <WH120>, take up <WH5375> a lamentation <WH7015> for Tyrus <WH6865>;

And say <WH559> unto Tyrus <WH6865>, O thou that art situate <WH3427> at the entry <WH3997> of the sea <WH3220>, which art a merchant <WH7402> of the people <WH5971> for many <WH7227> isles <WH339>, Thus saith <WH559> the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069>; O Tyrus <WH6865>, thou hast said <WH559>, I am of perfect <WH3632> beauty <WH3308>.
Thy borders <WH1366> are in the midst <WH3820> of the seas <WH3220>, thy builders <WH1129> have perfected <WH3634> thy beauty <WH3308>.
They have made <WH1129> all thy ship boards <WH3871> of fir trees <WH1265> of Senir <WH8149>: they have taken <WH3947> cedars <WH730> from Lebanon <WH3844> to make <WH6213> masts <WH8650> for thee.

Of the oaks <WH437> of Bashan <WH1316> have they made <WH6213> thine oars <WH4880>; the company <WH1323> of the Ashurites <WH839> have made <WH6213> thy benches <WH7175> of ivory <WH8127>, brought out of the isles <WH339> of Chittim <WH3794>.

Fine linen <WH8336> with broidered work <WH7553> from Egypt <WH4714> was that which thou spreadest forth <WH4666> to be thy sail <WH5251>; blue <WH8504> and purple <WH713> from the isles <WH339> of Elishah <WH473> was that which covered <WH4374> thee.
The inhabitants <WH3427> of Zidon <WH6721> and Arvad <WH719> were thy mariners <WH7751>: thy wise <WH2450> men, O Tyrus <WH6865>, that were in thee, were thy pilots <WH2259>.

The ancients <WH2205> of Gebal <WH1380> and the wise <WH2450> men thereof were in thee thy calkers <WH919> <WH2388>: all the ships <WH591> of the sea <WH3220> with their mariners <WH4419> were in thee to occupy <WH6148> thy merchandise <WH4627>.

They of Persia <WH6539> and of Lud <WH3865> and of Phut <WH6316> were in thine army <WH2428>, thy men <WH582> of war <WH4421>: they hanged <WH8518> the shield <WH4043> and helmet <WH3553> in thee; they set forth <WH5414> thy comeliness <WH1926>.

The men <WH1121> of Arvad <WH719> with thine army <WH2428> were upon thy walls <WH2346> round about <WH5439>, and the Gammadims <WH1575> were in thy towers <WH4026>: they hanged <WH8518> their shields <WH7982> upon thy walls <WH2346> round about <WH5439>; they have made <WH3634> thy beauty <WH3308> perfect <WH3634>.

Tarshish <WH8659> was thy merchant <WH5503> by reason of the multitude <WH7230> of all kind of riches <WH1952>; with silver <WH3701>, iron <WH1270>, tin <WH913>, and lead <WH5777>, they traded <WH5414> in thy fairs <WH5801>.

Javan <WH3120>, Tubal <WH8422>, and Meshech <WH4902>, they were thy merchants <WH7402>: they traded <WH5414> the persons <WH5315> of men <WH120> and vessels <WH3627> of brass <WH5178> in thy market <WH4627>.
They of the house <WH1004> of Togarmah <WH8425> traded <WH5414> in thy fairs <WH5801> with horses <WH5483> and horsemen <WH6571> and mules <WH6505>.

The men <WH1121> of Dedan <WH1719> were thy merchants <WH7402>; many <WH7227> isles <WH339> were the merchandise <WH5506> of thine hand <WH3027>: they brought <WH7725> thee for a present <WH814> horns <WH7161> of ivory <WH8127> and ebony <WH1894>.

Syria <WH758> was thy merchant <WH5503> by reason of the multitude <WH7230> of the wares of thy making <WH4639>: they occupied <WH5414> in thy fairs <WH5801> with emeralds <WH5306>, purple <WH713>, and broidered work <WH7553>, and fine linen <WH948>, and coral <WH7215>, and agate <WH3539>.

Judah <WH3063>, and the land <WH776> of Israel <WH3478>, they were thy merchants <WH7402>: they traded <WH5414> in thy market <WH4627> wheat <WH2406> of Minnith <WH4511>, and Pannag <WH6436>, and honey <WH1706>, and oil <WH8081>, and balm <WH6875>.

Damascus <WH1834> was thy merchant <WH5503> in the multitude <WH7230> of the wares of thy making <WH4639>, for the multitude <WH7230> of all riches <WH1952>; in the wine <WH3196> of Helbon <WH2463>, and white <WH6713> wool <WH6785>.

Dan <WH2051> <WH1835> also and Javan <WH3120> going to and fro <WH235> occupied <WH5414> in thy fairs <WH5801>: bright <WH6219> iron <WH1270>, cassia <WH6916>, and calamus <WH7070>, were in thy market <WH4627>.
Dedan <WH1719> was thy merchant <WH7402> in precious <WH2667> clothes <WH899> for chariots <WH7396>.

Arabia <WH6152>, and all the princes <WH5387> of Kedar <WH6938>, they occupied <WH5503> with thee <WH3027> in lambs <WH3733>, and rams <WH352>, and goats <WH6260>: in these were they thy merchants <WH5503>.

The merchants <WH7402> of Sheba <WH7614> and Raamah <WH7484>, they were thy merchants <WH7402>: they occupied <WH5414> in thy fairs <WH5801> with chief <WH7218> of all spices <WH1314>, and with all precious <WH3368> stones <WH68>, and gold <WH2091>.
Haran <WH2771>, and Canneh <WH3656>, and Eden <WH5729>, the merchants <WH7402> of Sheba <WH7614>, Asshur <WH804>, and Chilmad <WH3638>, were thy merchants <WH7402>.

These were thy merchants <WH7402> in all sorts <WH4360> of things, in blue <WH8504> clothes <WH1545>, and broidered work <WH7553>, and in chests <WH1595> of rich apparel <WH1264>, bound <WH2280> with cords <WH2256>, and made of cedar <WH729>, among thy merchandise <WH4819>.

The ships <WH591> of Tarshish <WH8659> did sing <WH7788> of thee in thy market <WH4627>: and thou wast replenished <WH4390>, and made very <WH3966> glorious <WH3513> in the midst <WH3820> of the seas <WH3220>.
Â¶ Thy rowers <WH7751> have brought <WH935> thee into great <WH7227> waters <WH4325>: the east <WH6921> wind <WH7307> hath broken <WH7665> thee in the midst <WH3820> of the seas <WH3220>.

Thy riches <WH1952>, and thy fairs <WH5801>, thy merchandise <WH4627>, thy mariners <WH4419>, and thy pilots <WH2259>, thy calkers <WH919> <WH2388>, and the occupiers <WH6148> of thy merchandise <WH4627>, and all thy men <WH582> of war <WH4421>, that are in thee, and in all thy company <WH6951> which is in the midst <WH8432> of thee, shall fall <WH5307> into the midst <WH3820> of the seas <WH3220> in the day <WH3117> of thy ruin <WH4658>.
The suburbs <WH4054> shall shake <WH7493> at the sound <WH6963> of the cry <WH2201> of thy pilots <WH2259>.

And all that handle <WH8610> the oar <WH4880>, the mariners <WH4419>, and all the pilots <WH2259> of the sea <WH3220>, shall come down <WH3381> from their ships <WH591>, they shall stand <WH5975> upon the land <WH776>;

And shall cause their voice <WH6963> to be heard <WH8085> against thee, and shall cry <WH2199> bitterly <WH4751>, and shall cast up <WH5927> dust <WH6083> upon their heads <WH7218>, they shall wallow <WH6428> themselves in the ashes <WH665>:

And they shall make themselves utterly <WH7144> bald <WH7139> for thee, and gird <WH2296> them with sackcloth <WH8242>, and they shall weep <WH1058> for thee with bitterness <WH4751> of heart <WH5315> and bitter <WH4751> wailing <WH4553>.

And in their wailing <WH5204> they shall take up <WH5375> a lamentation <WH7015> for thee, and lament <WH6969> over thee, saying, What city is like Tyrus <WH6865>, like the destroyed <WH1822> in the midst <WH8432> of the sea <WH3220>?

When thy wares <WH5801> went forth <WH3318> out of the seas <WH3220>, thou filledst <WH7646> many <WH7227> people <WH5971>; thou didst enrich <WH6238> the kings <WH4428> of the earth <WH776> with the multitude <WH7230> of thy riches <WH1952> and of thy merchandise <WH4627>.

In the time <WH6256> when thou shalt be broken <WH7665> by the seas <WH3220> in the depths <WH4615> of the waters <WH4325> thy merchandise <WH4627> and all thy company <WH6951> in the midst <WH8432> of thee shall fall <WH5307>.

All the inhabitants <WH3427> of the isles <WH339> shall be astonished <WH8074> at thee, and their kings <WH4428> shall be sore <WH8178> afraid <WH8175>, they shall be troubled <WH7481> in their countenance <WH6440>.
The merchants <WH5503> among the people <WH5971> shall hiss <WH8319> at thee; thou shalt be a terror <WH1091>, and never shalt be any more <WH5704> <WH5769>.
